Reviews.Title: “room was horrible, very dissapointing :(”
Reviews.Author: serenity200
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointing stay. I was expecting it to be gorgeous. Our room stank of must and was so run down. It was the worst hotel room i ever stayed in. I couldnt believe it. I didnt complain as i didnt want to cause a fuss so i just got on with it. The food is rediculously over priced. My husband and me had a salad each and a mineral in a barbeque outside. We paid like 90 euro for it!!!! Crazy hotel. Will never ever stay there again.....

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome..ah..Venice, do as the Venetians!”
Reviews.Author: Sherwood007
Reviews.Content: Over the top. Directly in front of the beach...private beach. Price included breakfast buffet, which was amazing. We ate there for hours every day, nearly until lunch, and out on the patio in the sunshine it was special. Free transportation to/from Venice via hand crafted wooden passenger boat (shuttle bus to casino where the boat launch was). Hotel is very old, but very nice, it's like something you would see in the movies about royal families from 150 years ago. The windows are 14 feet tall, and open like french doors, the bathrooms are all marble. Ceiling height is about 16 feet, the beds are huge, and we chose the cheapest rooms available...I can only imagine what the luxury suites would be like. I think we paid about $120us per night, it was extremely worth it. I imagine in high season it would have been much more expensive though. We stayed the week after the Venice Film Festival, and all the movie stars stay here. I was visiting a friend in a hotel in Venice, the room was like a closet, and 4x more expensive. So it takes 45 minutes to travel to Venice, so what...live like a rock star, and go visit the antiquities in Venice at your leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Magic but far from Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lozio
Reviews.Content: The hotel has its magic. It's elegant and it smells decadence (in a good way), with silver spoons and things like that. But it needs a little bit more of attention. And something more, especially for the price, which is good, if you compare it to other other of the same levels in Venice. But you're not precisly in Venice. You're at the Lido: beautiful place but, again, it's not Venice. Venice is at 10 minutes of ferry. Don't get me wrong: the trip to go and back is worth (astonishing views) but if you do that for a couple of days and not late in the night or in wintertime. Staff is ok and so is the service. Some of the technological equipments may need to be updated. Again: good place, after all. With history and 5 star elegance, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm belies a more run down, outdated interior.”
Reviews.Author: blackdog1979
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly, but services was limited to the typical continental european vacation. Beware how far away the Lido is when booking. If you're not here to stay the majority of time on the island, you may find it to be a pain like I did. I wanted to spend the bulk of my time in Venice and it was complex and time-consuming to take water taxis back and forth every day. There also weren't a lot of restaurant choices around when I stayed on the island. The room decor was old, run down, and outdated. But it was of average cleanliness and for the price I paid I thought I got what I paid for. I wouldn't stay here again as it's too far away from where I want to be when I visit this part of the world - Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel but money stolen from room!”
Reviews.Author: PembrokeshireCariad
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, it was lovely staying on the Lido and complimentary launches made everything so easy. Lovely grounds, superb breakfast with endless choices of cooked, pastries, cereals, fruits etc. Very grand and as a romatic getaway it was perfect. The only thing that spoiled our stay was when we had money taken from our locked room. Yes they had a safe but we left our room for an evening stroll after it had been serviced not dreaming that someone would come in and steal from us. The gentleman on reception was less than helpful which we were surprised at but the lady on the next shift more sympathetic but still nothing done.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice... and the Hotel des Bains was lovely”
Reviews.Author: jubaanne
Reviews.Content: An unexpected change from the usual chain hotels we had as part of a tour group stay, we thought the Hotel Des Bains was a wonderful introduction to beautiful Venice. Although we would have liked to stay on the main island, it was still a treat to have water transport a necessity for our venice stay. The hotel was magnificent, very opulent, classy and full of old style in a very stylish way. The bedroom was huge, and furnished well, bed so comfortable, marble bathrooms huge and well equipped with nice toiletries. Staff not overly friendly, but this was no concern to us. We loved this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Breakfast buffets were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieA1
Reviews.Content: Incredible Hotel! Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Style and service lives on at the Des Bains”
Reviews.Author: queentigerlily
Reviews.Content: Have returned for a short trip after quite a lengthy gap was delighted to find some of my best memories rekindled, with standards and service and style I thought had disappeared in most of the bland standardised and souless hotel chains of the world. I was so glad to find some experiences can be revisited without being a disappointment.. The restaurant, the welcoming staff and the beach cabanas were impeccable, just like it has always been..I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fading grandeur, great position, aloof staff, very expensive restaurent”
Reviews.Author: DrJoCardiff
Reviews.Content: Instructions to get there difficult, miss the restaurant apart from breakfast very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “No airconditioning in October - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Venice can still be very warm in early October but the hotel switches off the air conditioning in October. The room was really stuffy. When I opened the windows ferocious mosquitos came in and bit me all night. They advertise they have airconditioning but do not tell you it is turned off! The hotel is historic but its just worth a look around do not stay here. Stay in Venice proper where the hotels have airconditioning in October!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Spohisticated; probably the most wonderful hotel in the whole world.”
Reviews.Author: gingerrogers4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Grand Hotel Des Bains in Venice so many times I can't remember when was the first, but I'm telling you there is nowhere in the world so perfectly situated or so well cared for and I would never consider staying anywhere else unless I had to. I cannot imagine not being able to go there and experience paradise for a few days when i need to. The hotel is spacious enough for you to be anonymous, but friendly enough for you to be known if you want to and the service is discreet when you want it to be and full-on when you need it. It is an exceptionally well-run hotel. Only one hour and forty five minutes from London and then an hour on the boat to Lido, this hotel is smack bang between the devil and the deep blue sea, surrounded by water; the beach and sea on one side and the Venice lagoon on the other. The rooms are huge, the decor is Venice in 1900, the breakfast is the best i've ever had, the swimming pool is set in acres of beautiful parkland and is huge (if a little cold),and the best thing by far is that you get to get away from all those big parties of tourists on Venice Island and come back to peace and quiet. If you want a few days in Paradise do yourself a favour: It's Venice's best kept secret! I'm only telling you now because for some reason I think it's in trouble; otherwise i'd keep it to myself.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a wonderful birthday”
Reviews.Author: Lily49Berwickshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly fantastic the staff are friendly nothing too much trouble. We went for my 60th birthday with our Son and his wife. We ate in the restaurant on the first evening very expensive but it made the occasion. Wonderful meal. The breakfast was like nothing we have seen before it was a feast for a king and no one rushed you they were still bringing bacon out at 10.30 The boat to and from Venice was a real treat as it ran up to 12 midnight. Also the Lido is quieter than Venice proper and nice to walk as not so many people but nice places to eat not as expensive as the main land. We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay and now wish we had spent all 4 nights in this truly magnificent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice old hotel, could do with some upkeep”
Reviews.Author: plant_a_tree_now
Reviews.Content: Wonderful historical hotel, with large park and swimming pool. At the end of September the hotel was quiet and the staff knowledgeable and professional My room was quiet and cool, despite AC not working and a small toilet leak. The hotel could do with some upkeep, and then it woudl be perfect. Also, the internet rate were overpriced. All in all, it is great in the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: curlytopsessex
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful trip to Venice and had a fantastic stay at the Hotel Des Bains. Nothing could have prepared us for the grand opulence of this beautiful hotel. The staff are friendly and very professional and gave the impression that nothing was too much trouble. We could not hide the jaw dropping experience it was to arrive at such a magical place. We got a very good deal with Expedia.com at what should have been a very expensive hotel. The only down side to our trip was that we would have liked to have dined at he hotel but when we checked the menu we thought that it was way over priced and were not prepared to pay so much. We did not actually see any one in the restaurant during our stay. The breakfast, however, which was included in the price was very good. Again service was impeccable and there was even a bottle of sparkling wine for whoever wanted it which we had on the morning of our anniversary. Very decadent!! We had a lovely big room on the corner of the hotel so had a view of the sea and the garden. There is a pool in the grounds but it was closed and we did not have time to use it anyway. The room was clean and bright with pieces of furniture which matched the character of the hotel. Anyone who likes original charm will love this hotel. The hotel has a mini bus which takes you to their sister hotel, The Excelsior, from which they run a boat over to Venice. All gratis. Would suggest you get there early as it can get busy. We had a messy end to our trip courtesy of Alitalia which included delays, canceled flight and then lost luggage. Not good at all. But Venice and hotel Des Bains was a great combination and would highly recommend a visit. One last tip, remember to bring an insect repellent as we did get bitten quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance on the Lido”
Reviews.Author: raylaw323
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Des Bains for our 10th anniversary. This was the 2nd time at this hotel; the first one being in 2001. The hotel is now run by an independent company and is not a Sheraton anymore. The hotel is old world elegant with nice, big rooms. The breakfast is a must and plentiful. The restaurant for dinner is much too expensive so we did not try. Instead we found good food on the main street of Lido which is 5-10 minute walking distance at the most. To get to Venice proper you can take the complimentary shuttle service to the sister hotel, the Excelsior. From there the boat trip is about 10-12 minutes. We recommend this hotel for all those who do not want the bustle of Venice yet yearn for good service and convenient locatin.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Lido, magical stay, magic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susanna09
Reviews.Content: What a treat to spend five days at the hotel des bains! Definitely a hotel in the old style, I felt at times as though I was wandering through the Titanic - huge public rooms, long corridors, sumptuous dining rooms, glass chandeliers, parquet flooring. Everything was over the top. We were there off season, and the private beach across the road was deserted and spectacular. The pool in the gardens was chilly but great fun. The buffet breakfast was delicious and abundant. Taking a private motor boat into Venice from the nearby Hotel Excelsior was a special treat! We had a small child with us and were always treated with courtesy and friendliness by all staff. We were given a mini-suite on the 3d floor, which was brilliant for fitting our child's cot - it was huge, with a dressing area and an extra-long bathroom. We would recommend this hotel at any time, although I imagine the "scene" would be quite different (and definitely more hectic) in the full summer season.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: Buckcastle
Reviews.Content: From the very moment we arrived at the Hotel, the front of house staff were polite, professional and helpful. This is a grand hotel by any standard and its view over the Adriatic sea makes it hard to beat, alongside its sister hotel, the Excelsor just down the road. The hotel runs a free shuttle service into st venice - a short coach ride to the Excelsor's launch facility, then a fast boat ride directly into St Mark's Square. Although we did not have lunch or dinner in the hotel (very expensive) the breakfast service was superb - a wide range of foods and the opportunity to enjoy it sitting outside on the terrace. There are a number of local resturants situated on the road to the main Ferry terminal which are a good alternative for evening dining. The room was spacious, if a little dated, but kept to a high standard of cleanliness. Finally, the hotel is set in wooded grounds and has its own outdoor pool area which is suitable for both families and those looking for a quiet location. Although the hotel has its own private beach, it was not open the week we were there (last week of May) but having said that, a great time to be there as the hotel was not at all crowded.

Reviews.Title: “If you like decadence, you must come (run) here”
Reviews.Author: marco_mazzei
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend, planning to have some days at the beach of the Lido. The Des Bains is famous because is the hotel of Death In Venice by Luchino Visconti, and the atmosphere you'll find is exactly that kind of decadence (but you have to run, because the hotel will be transformed into a big condos, or something like that). The hall, the big rooms near the entrance, the restaurant, the park all around the hotel and the pool: everything is gorgeous. With our Expedia-rate we got a room with no view, but with great furniture and a perfect - I want to say again: perfect - room service. No Internet connection in the room, and no wifi in the building. The beach in front of the hotel is nice, but rates for the best locations are too high, and for the affordable rate you're so far from the beach, that probably is better to stay in the hotel's pool. Average breakfast. The hotel has a complimentary transport service from the Lido to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “magical”
Reviews.Author: katefinneran
Reviews.Content: I am 27 and have been going to the Des Bains with my family in the summer for all of my life. The Hotel is truly magical. The lido itself is so other -worldly and the elegance and ease of the Des Bains makes the vacation even more wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel for families. I feel like the excelsior hotel on the lido is a better choice for couples and people wishing to find more of a party scene or a place to wear super dolled up clothes. The Des Bains, despite it's steep price, actually has a lovely casual simple atmosphere about it while maintaining sophisticated elegance. It is great for couples if you desire a relaxed and mellow stay. The concierges are all wonderful if you treat them like human beings and refrain from acting aggressive or tacky. Have a sense of humor with them and say "thank you" and they will do ANYTHING for you. Besides San Francisco ( where I live) this is m favorite place in the world. The Starwood now longer owns the Des Bains which is really a blessing. I began staying there years before they bought it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robbo44Melbourne
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel but was let down by poor concierges and very rude waiters. We were part of a tour group and they really have to decide if they want this type of clientele or not.We were not made to feel welcome in fact the staff appeared to resent us yet the hotel and its facilities were really very good.We had a dinner which was not edible.

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgia in Venice”
Reviews.Author: elena52
Reviews.Content: Three wonderful nights in Hotel des Bains...a very special place to be. Tastes differ: if you are looking for a perfect service, topmodern comfort, very well-kept rooms etc. , this may be not the right place for you. On the other hand: if you are looking for a nostalgic and romantic atmosphere you will not be disappointed. Even the hold-back attitude from the waiter in the corner of the beautiful liberty-style dinner-room will help thinking you live in days long past...... When we arrived there was no porter to help us and we had to carry our luggage into the huge and impressive hall. Reception and check-in were adequate but rather cold in manner; not very friendly. Our room was quiet and comfortable. We stayed on the 4th with a nice and beautiful view over the garden and - a little far away- you could see the lagune, ships passing by ( cruiseships and motorboats) and Venice. Bathroom was o.k with old marble, good comfort and clean. Sheets, bath robes and towels: perfect. Nice painted ceiling in the room, nice Liberty furniture, carpet and paint on the doors a little bit worn. Booking by internet ( Starwood) we asked for prosecco in the room and there was not only prosecco but also a very nice and delicious fruitbasket. All rooms, XL corridors and halls have cracking and glimmering parquet floors. The Murano lustres are sumptuous. Breakfast was good, 4 star standard. Excellent shuttle- service, always right in time and in only a few minutes you are at the Westin Excelsior. From Excelsior to Danieli or Gritti Palace there are connecting motortaxis for free every 30 minutes and till late in the evening. We had dinner and lunch two times and the food was brilliant but rather expensive and the personal over all is not so attentive. Anyhow this is a very romantic and unforgettable place to be when you are in the mood!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the modern traveler”
Reviews.Author: Briarrose6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. And I certainly recommend staying in Lido Beach, it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle away from the city main area. The hotel was grand with large rooms and huge chandeliers throughout. The fitness room was nice with up-to-date equipment. The pool was nice, however no hot tub and it was generally too cool for the pool outside, so a hot tub would have been nice. The room was spacious, and when we asked for a king size bed at check in (instead of twin beds pushed together) we were granted our request and given a spacious room. The staff were nice, but not exceptionally friendly. The internet situation was not good. We needed to check in for our flight online and we were charged 5 euro for 15 minutes, which was expensive. Breakfast was OK. No variation to the offerings, so by our third morning we were very bored with it. Location was good, short walk to the vaperetto and good places to eat close by. I feel this is the kind of place my Mother would love, but for my husband and I, we felt it was a bit old-fashioned. We noticed the paint in the hallways was old and worn off.

Reviews.Title: “heaven”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBoris
Reviews.Content: Wow! One of my fave places in the world! If you are in Venice for one night it is not your best option but if you are there to stay for a few days it is just perfect. You can get to Lido by vporetto or by the free shuttle leaving from the neighbouring Excalibur every hour. Rooms are huge and bright, the pool is refreshing and breakfast is delicious and what makes it even better is that you can sit on the terrace. The beach is right across the street too. You get up in the morning, have breakfast, take the shuttle/vaporetto to Venice and enjoy it until lunch when you go back tot he hotel to rest and take a dip in the pool and then in the aftenoon you go back to Venice again...Ahh...

Reviews.Title: “Be Very Aware”
Reviews.Author: colnagogirl339
Reviews.Content: We too did not know that the hotel had had a recent fire. The hotel is in the process of "updating or fixing" Does not matter. We orginally booked 2 rooms, close to each other. Not only were they not close to each other, they were on different floors and different parts of the hotel they could only be accessed by different elevators. So my family was not together. The hotel had heavy paint fumes. We switched rooms, by midnight we "settled on a room that had an airconditioner that barely worked and had mold all around the vent. We were not the only people having problems. There were several people also switching rooms because of the paint smell. The location may be great, but this hotel is VERY RUN DOWN!! Lobby area was HUGE...but hardly any furniture. This place has great potential and Sheraton should do something about it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but over priced”
Reviews.Author: albion23
Reviews.Content: Without doubt a fantastic hotel and a great location away from the crowds in venice with a great out door pool . Generally clean but needs updateing in certain area's but didnt bother me or my girlfriend to much. However make sure you bring an iron. We asked to borrow one and they told us not to worry as they have a cleaning service. It cost 78 Euro's to iron a shirt , 2 x T-shirts and a skirt. Total rip off which left a very bitter taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old Opulence”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Des Bains For anyone who's seen Death in Venice, the hotel has barely changed, and we loved wandering its old opulent corridors and public rooms The pool is huge and set in landscaped grounds with tall trees surrounding it. The beach cabanas were lovely and filled with Italian families chilling out under the canopies. Breakfast was an extensive buffet with helpful staff on hand for fresh coffee, all served on a sunny outdoor terrace This is not the place for plasma screen TVs, concept showers or designer furniture, but if like us you love turn of the century opulence, creaky parquet flooring, old iron room keys and marble topped dressers, you'll love the Des Bains. The staff throughout were friendly and helpful, assisting with restaurant and water taxi bookings. The bus shuttle to the Excelsior took a few minutes and was regular and punctual, leading to the Excelsior pier and private free water taxi into St Marks area. The Lido is a real getaway. You can escape the crowds and hubbub of Venice with a parkland hotel, the seaside and pool and lovely beach resort cafes and bars along the main strip. We loved the regular water taxi trips speeding across the bay into the sunset and watching the Venice skyline from the sea - it was really exhilerating and a highlight of the trip We can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: blackfish
Reviews.Content: A completely great time. While the hotel hallways are a bit worn, our rooms were beautiful and enormous by any standard. The staff was always helpful and pool area was great for the kids. We stayed on site during the hottest times of day. The cafes overlooking Venice from the Lido were inexpensive and the food was terrific and were only a short walk away. We used the shuttle to go to the Westin and took the boat to Marco's square for free in the morning and evening. I can't imagine a nicer place to stay. We had a terrific view from the sea front rooms, but the water was kind of nasty with things floating around. I'd recommend to anyone and would love to visit again. Only ate in the pool area once, it was pricey about $120 for lunch for four with umbrella drinks but good.

Reviews.Title: “TIred looking hotel and shockingly poor service”
Reviews.Author: Hort_and_Culture
Reviews.Content: Maybe there are better rooms but my huge room 130 was in dire need of a makeover. Pale carpet was badly stained, furniture chipped and the general look was of neglect. The bed was comfortable with great bed linen. The airconditioning unit was in the wall - the grille had fallen off and the wall wasbadly stained around the outlet. The bathroom was just ok - shower unit old and a bit grubby Check-in procedure was shockingly poor for a 5 star hotel The public areas look unkempt - theres a distinct lack of charm The breakfast buffet was poor - and on Sunday morning the staff couldnt keep it stocked up The location on the beach is great and the shuttle to the Excelsior and the boat service to Venice excellent - Unless you get a really good rate here - think twice about staying - there may be better refurbished rooms but Im not sure.....overall poor.

Reviews.Title: “away from the crowds of Venice”
Reviews.Author: atlfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and our room was very spacious, especially by Italian standards. We had a room that overlooked the Adriatic sea. The breakfast buffet was nice, but the birds flying in the dining room was a little,um, unsanitary. We enjoyed staying on the Lido island because it was quieter than Venice. However, if you are short on time you might want to consider staying in Venice because the boat ride to and from the island does take a little bit of time. The hotel does provide a private boat service which is very nice. You don't need to take the private boat to Murano even though it is free from hotel. They take you to a glass factory and the pressure to purchase is INTENSE to say the least. I would recommend taking a vaporetto over to Murano and doing your own looking and comparing.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Lido/Venice for families with children”
Reviews.Author: Orbit0353
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Des Bains, so we knew what to expect. When traveling with children, Des Bains is the best alternative if you want to both go swimming, as well as sightseeing in Venice. The Lido location implies that it takes you 30 minutes to get downtown. There is a bus shuttle to the sister hotel Excelsior, connecting to a water shuttle downtown every half hour. Both are free for guests, and are anyhow more comfortable that crowded public transport. So this is not for those who want to make Venice in a day or two, but rather for the more relaxed schedule. And Des Bains is definitively a lot more relaxing than the hectic downtown. The hotel got â€œdowngradedâ€� from a Westin to a Sheraton in 2007, probably a more truthful classification. The hotel is around hundred years old; you should decide for yourself whether you would classify this as â€œcharmâ€� or â€œwornâ€�. Most things have definitively been modernized throughout the years, but you will experience quirking floors and doors that does not fit snugly. The air-condition is also substandard. We were staying during a very hot period (around 34 Celsius outside), and the room temperature would not go below 25 even with AC set to max cooling. Apart from this, we found everything to be of high standard. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and well maintained. We had an extra spacious room, accommodating two adults + two children, will still a lot of space for a desk, drawer, and lounge chairs. Sea view rooms are more expensive, but worth it if you are on a floor that would overlook the trees in the garden (3rd floor and upwards). The breakfast buffet had a good selection of cold cuts, cheese, cereals, fruits and pastries. There are also a limited number of hot dishes, mostly scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages and mushrooms. Additional items (like boiled eggs) can be obtained from the waiters, although they do not advertise this. For lunch there are two alternatives by the pool, either an outdoor restaurant, or the pool bar. The bar has more snack-like meals like sandwiches and hamburgers (around â‚¬20), while the restaurant has larger dishes and a buffet (around â‚¬35). The dinner restaurant is also rather expensive (starters â‚¬25, main dishes â‚¬35, desert â‚¬ 10, cover charge â‚¬12), easily exceeding â‚¬100 per person including beverage. (Even a small bottle of soft drink is charged â‚¬7.) We had half-board, and thus dined as the restaurant most days. There are only a limited number of main dishes (3 fish, 3 meat, 2 vegetarian, 3 local specialties), and no daily menu supplement. Thus we needed to repeat some selections during our stay. The food is very good though, but not better that what you should expect at those prices. For swimming, there are two options: Either the pool or the beach. The pool is very large, with depth from 1 to 3.5 meters. There is also a separate children section for non-swimmers. (We had lunch one day at the neighbor Excelsior, and their pool is only a quarter of the size). The pool is located in a park with sundeck chairs. There are also tennis courts for rental at the corner of the park. Some of the trees was in blossom during our stay, implying a lot of flowers in the pool (despite frequent cleaning during the day), that colored any white swimwear yellowish, but it washed out easily when we got home. The other alternative is the beach. Entry to the beach is at additional cost, unless you have chairs or cabins included in your room rate. Rates are from around â‚¬10 for a locker, to â‚¬210 for a front row â€œtuculâ€�. The sea water is rather salt, and definitively not crystal clear. Due to the salt content, you should always shower afterwards to avoid rashes. So swimming conditions are definitively better in the pool, but there is always some extra magic in being on a beach. The staff at Des Bains is excellent. The restaurant staff is although not always able to understand English, so make sure they have understood any non-Italian order. Just around the corer of the hotel is the main street of Lidos â€œdowntownâ€� area, with numerous shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Always quiet and charming”
Reviews.Author: French
Reviews.Content: We try to go back regularly every year, since we like the atmosphere of this hotel. This time again we were not disappointed. The room was very large (and most rooms are spacious in this hotel). Great park and swimming-pool (but beware of the mosquitoes). Good restaurant, but definitely over-priced. Efficient shuttle service by minim-bus and boat to get to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: mouriln
Reviews.Content: Talk about overpriced!!! The walls are cracking, the sinks didn't have plugs that worked and the ceiling was open and mosquitoes were coming through. They prohibited ironing in the room and charged $22 to iron a top and skirt! The breakfast buffet was fairly decent and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I guess what it comes down to is location, location, location. Right across from the beach was a definite plus! The shuttle service was prompt and efficient, although you have to pay to get to the service from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “unfortunately a fabulous city break ruined”
Reviews.Author: ryanhart
Reviews.Content: I booked for my family to have a city break to venice,i search for the hotel that sounded the best for us. when we arrived at hotel Des Bains we were very impressed it looked fabulous,also on checking in the staff were very friendly ,the hotel was very quite not many guests i realised it was still early in the season. We arrived at the hotel around lunch time,reception told us our rooms were not ready so we decided to have some lunch while we were waiting.After a short time a member of staff came and told us when we were ready we would be shown to our rooms. We had two rooms they were on different floors for some reason ,very stranged as the hotel was so quite.We decided between us that because the time was moving on we would just drop off our bags and go and have a walk then come back to get changed to go to venice for the evening. We were not out of the hotel two hours, on return we found no forced entry to either room but a considerable sum of english money had gone from one room (this was not left on show) and some loose change from the other. Obviously we reported this straight away and got the police involved . This is now nine weeks on and still nothing has been done,the hotel manager has only just reported it to the insurance he has not been very helpful. I just want to make people aware of the problem this hotel may have.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Lido”
Reviews.Author: loveitalianstyle
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Bains is romantic and charming. The lobby area is very palatial and quite spacious. It is decorated with beautiful hanging chandeliers, and the wood floor gives it an Old World feel. The bedroom was very nice and the A/C functioned well. The bathroom was spacious and luxurious. Breakfast was quite abundant which included a delicious smoked salmon. Our teenage boys enjoyed the pool area. Hotel des Bains is a great place for relaxation if you want to get away from the crowd of St. Mark's Square. Travelling with a tour did not afford us enough time to enjoy the hotel. I would love to stay there again some day! The beach area across the street is also very nice. Hotel Des Bains is a paradise in Lido. Viva Venezia! a unique place in the world! Viva Hotel Des Bains! we shall return some day!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: sandiegotravelers7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week Perillo tour of Italy. I have to say that the Hotel Des Bains was the nicest we stayed at in all of Italy. Our room was VERY large and the bathroom was great. Most of the bathrooms in Italy were very small and not comfortable. We loved the location of the hotel. It is on the island of Lido which is away from the hussle and bussle of San Marco. It had a very relaxed atmosphere, almost resort like. The hotel was very nice and clean. The breakfast buffet was excellent especially the fruit and pastries. The staff was friendly and accomodating. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: WWtraveller
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at the Hotel des Bains. The hotel is in need of some upgrading but has a welcoming feel to it. The conciege in the hotel was most helpful and assisted in choosing locations for dinner in Venice and also transport and taxis when needed, all performed in a very charming and accomodating manner We stayed on a bed a breakfast basis and I could not complain of the choice of foods in the morning. Best to stick to Continental however but the fresh fruit and pastries were wonderful!! It is a lovely hotel and the location on the Lido is perfect, you have the use of the Excelsior free launch to the other sister hotels in Venice and is a lovely way to get into and out of Venice and staying on the Lido allows you to get away from the hordes of people and relax on the lido. The Lido is also a more cost effective option that venice itself and we had many lovely dinners on the lido for less than half the price of Venice itself.

Reviews.Title: “Faded charm”
Reviews.Author: Cruiserjools
Reviews.Content: After 3 nights in the centre of Venice, we opted for 2 nights on the Lido. We took the waterbus (no. 1) since we had a 3-day ticket which was still valid, and then took a leisurely stroll up the promenade (15 minutes at most) to the Hotel des Bains. We were impressed with its grandeur on first sight, and the chairs and tables on the verandah looked very inviting. Reception/concierge were very good,and we were escorted by the receptionist to our room, while the concierge took care of our bags. Our biggest disappointment was that in spite of the hotel being practically empty (it had opened for the season only 3 days before) we were given a room at the back, overlooking the garbage! It would have been no problem for the hotel to allocate us a room at the front. However, our room was spacious and well furnished; the bathroom was large and luxurious, and the walk-in wardrobe was a bonus. In-room mini-bar and "snack" prices were over the top, and we did not indulge! Breakfast buffet was first class, and we were surprised (after our central Venice experience) to find a hot option on offer (bacon etc) as well as the usual fruits, cold meats, cereals, smoked salmon, pastries, juices - and even Prosecco! We found the staff at breakfast a little snobbish - it obviously helped to be "somebody" to be seated somewhere nice in the restuarant - and on our second day we waited fully five minutes before the maitre d' (who had acknowledged our arrival) deigned to point us to a table at the very back of the restaurant.. The hotel, beach and entire Lido island were very obviously gearing up for the season, and as such there was very little on offer to us; the pool was just being filled, the gardeners were just planting out the "annuals" - in fact you couldn't even walk round the gardens, or sit out anywhere apart from the terrace at the front of the hotel (in spite of beautiful sunny and warm weather). The shuttle service to central Venice was wonderful! Minibus to the Excelsior, launch into Venice and the same back - we really felt we were travelling in style! Be warned though that the shuttles returning from Venice will leave exactly on time, so if you are even a couple of minutes late, you will have to wait for the next one! All in all a lovely experience; the Lido is so different from Venice, and we spent a lot of time exploring it. We would like to return "in season" to see the beaches in use (they were mostly closed) and this lovely hotel up and running at full speed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nemorino79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the last couple of years and wouldn't hesitate to go again. It's a magnificent palace on the beach, but you should consider the following before booking to make sure you won't be disappointed: As the hotel is on the Lido, it will take you 40 minutes to get to the centre of Venice, by the hotel's fabulous shuttle service that is. If you have little time in Venice and plan some non-stop sightseeing you might want to stay in the centre. The hotel features a magnificent pool in a wonderful garden which is great to relax from sightseeing, but only open mid-May to September. Before and after the pool-season the main argument to stay is the very competitive rates often offered online. In the off-season (of the Lido - there is none in Venice), I twice got rates for which you wouldn't even get a ***-hotel in the centre! The common rooms of the hotel are breathtaking and the guestrooms and bathrooms are very nicely appointed. The breakfast buffet is extensive. Be warned that everything not included in your rate (minibar, restaurant, roomservice,...) comes at outrageous prices! Do check for special offers at the Starwood website.

Reviews.Title: “Great but wish we would have stayyed closer to St. Mark's”
Reviews.Author: babyboo999
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights and four days at the Hotel Des Bains..It was a nice stay...The people at the hotel were very friendly and hospitable. We were on our honeymoon and found it to be a relaxing place and a nice little room witha great bathroom. If we had to do it over, I wish we could've moved the hotel to the main part of VEnice. Everything in Venice is very expensive and the most economical way to get around is on the water bus that goes up and down the grand canal. WHile stayying at the hotel, there is a bus that transfers you to the Westin Excelsior and from the Excelsior, a water boat shuttle takes you to hotels near ST. Mark's Sguare where everything pretty much is. It runs about every 15 minutes which is very convenient. There is not much to do at night there accept go to the casino, which was a fun expreience..We had to pay five dollars to get in and rent a jacket for my husband. The hotel breakfast is pretty goo with a good selection of foods, which I still tired off after the third day. Egg scrabled or boild, many fruits, cereal, bacon, sausage, muffins, croissants, and a variety of juices. The service was great at breakfast also. The hotel is closing soon for the winter. The beach was no where near as pretty as California's but very cloe, right accross the street. To get to the hotel from the airport, we walked straight out of the airport, headed left until we saw a sign for the allilaguna (water bus) that took us to the lido in about an our. The guy on the boat wil say LIDo pretty loud. It ws I believe the fourth stop. WE went to see glass blowing in Murano which is neat but kind of a scam to get you to buy lots of things. If you go th the Basilca later in the afternoon, the line is not that bad. The view from tha cmpanile was nice and not a long wait either. Doges Palace has very interesting prisons. To eat, Rafaelle's was delicious. For the GOndola ride at night we went to a travel agency near ST. Mark's Square to book a 50 minute nightime serenade for forty euro each. The usual is about 90 euro for the two of you alone, no singing.. The catch with ours was that the boat would have up to six people in it. The take alot of gondolas at once up and down the grand canal and the singing is amazing with a accordian and mic. Shopping in the rialto market near the bridge was the most economical for the best things. Bring DVDs and a mini playyer because the only thing on television at the hotel was pay per views and CNN in English. We had a good time but jetlag was horrible...BEd a a bit hard...Nive and quiet from the noise though...

Reviews.Title: “Lidi is a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HKbuddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Lido. When we arrived at the Lido Dock by Waterbus, we found that that the hotel is in a very short walking distance (10 minutes) from the pier. We did not need to take a taxi even we had a luggage. We stored the remaining luggages in the train station for few days, but it was not too expensive. I therefore suggest anyone who visited Venice can store their big luggages in train station in prior to taking water bus. We had a pleasant check-in. We had a room with a large bathroom. The bed is comfortable, but one little thing is that some kinds of bugs bite at my wife in the first night. The breakfast is OK, not much suprised. Outside the hotel, there is a beach where we found a lot of shells. We found some good restaurants in Lido. In fact, the Lido area is more relaxing than San Marco area, which I think I would stay at this island again if we visit Venice again in the future. Every morning we took a hotel shuttle to a dock in Excelsior Hotel, where we got a private boat to San Marco area. The whole journey takes about 45 minutes. Everynight when we came back, the boat is really "private" since we could not see any hotel guests in the boat besides us. It saves us a lot of money to take a private taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Lotsof Charm”
Reviews.Author: Marlin1
Reviews.Content: Yes the Hotel is old and would need some upgrading However, this charm cannot duplicated by any modern hotel. I am afraid it will not take too long this place is demolished or converted into condos. We found the service at the front desk and concierge excellent. The service at dinner was so so, ..the young people serving us still need some more training. Breakfast (buffet style) was excellent and coffee very good. This hotel is out of another world and an experience we would not have missed. Attention should be given on how to get there. Not knowing better we became a victim of some shabby operators who told us at the shore garage to take their (private) water taxi for â‚¬ 100 while the ferry a few steps further was only â‚¬ 40 return for a car and passengers.

Reviews.Title: “yuck”
Reviews.Author: mica178
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the Hotel Des Bains, having heard such positive reviews, but I found it to be mildew-y (more than is usual for Venice hotels), with creaking floors and uncomfortable beds. The man at the check-in counter was as un-helpful a person as I've ever met at a SPG property, esp. at this level. Within 10 minutes of our check-in, we were on the phone with SPG to be upgraded to the Europa e Regina in Venice, a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: cj15
Reviews.Content: Awesome view on the 4th floor overlooking the expansive Lido. We had a very large room, minimally furnished, but with three large windows and large bathroom. There was a small foyer before entering the bedroom for the closet area. This is an older hotel with great history. Fantastic pool area, didn't go swimming (a little chilly), but that is typical for European hotels. Front reception, Lola and Elena did a fabulous job, graciously welcoming and very helpful. From the bar services, breakfast services, concierge services to housekeeping services -we never waited once. On the day of departure, housekeeping provided me with fresh towels and toiletries. The breakfast buffet, including sparkling wine, had numerous food choices. I especially loved the fresh strawberries and juices. Our package included a cabana on the Lido- a bit disappointing. It was on the 3rd row, no sea view and too close to your neighbors. The location was great- they have bus shuttle services and water services from their sister hotels that make going into Venice easy and convenient. The neighborhood restaurants were reasonable and close by. Neg: There is a night club across the street. This can be loud on a weekend.s, but a fun place to go to if you like modern music. The large king bed was a bit hard, linens luxurious, but yet not the heavenly bed that I love about SPG. Bathroom needs a vanity mirror and furniture was overly simplistic. Overall, after spending time in Venice center, I prefer this area and hope to return next time with my family. I am very critical with all my reviews due to our many visits to both European and American hotels. This is a Great 5 star hotel and deserves a much higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Above our expectations”
Reviews.Author: julieparsons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Des Bains for four nights in June and wished we had booked for longer! Upgraded to a seaview room (which helped set the scene for the rest of our stay) we immediately felt totally comfortable with the casual elegance and unpretentious atmosphere that prevailed. The staff could not have been more attentive and helpful. From the concierge desk, where they spoke excellent English and nothing was too much trouble, to the friendly waiters and the efficient chamber maids, we could not fault them. Breakfast on the veranda overlooking the lovely gardens was memorable - our best hotel breakfast experience for a long time. The choice and standard of food and beverages was really good - a hot english breakfast which was constantly replenished, abundant fresh fruits, cold meats/smoked salmon, cereals and pastries, fresh juices and bucks fizz. The waitress delivered an espresso by mistake one morning (oh yes - they did make one mistake.....!) but it was so delicious that I continued to have them thereafter! The swimming pool was excellent - just the right temperature; plenty big enough to do laps and deep enough to dive. A swimming coach gave a few small children lessons for a while in the mornings. The separate children's pool and playing area were partly screened off by hedging and vegetation. We tried the barbeque and buffet one lunchtime and were very impressed - the crayfish were fantastic. The complimentary shuttle service to the Excelsior and water taxi to Venice worked extremely well - every 30 minutes. It dropped you off in a choice of three locations, including St Mark's Square. The Vaporetto (water bus to all neighbouring islands) was a short walk down the main street - where we also enjoyed some good evening meals- restaurants recommended by the concierge. Hiring a two-seater bicycle was a worthwhile experience for one morning -stopping at a beach club just beyond the Excelsior to enjoy a very cheap but good lunch with lovely relaxed atmosphere. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a Grand Dame!”
Reviews.Author: RMAP
Reviews.Content: While I can appreciate the comments of a few reviewers who suggested the hotel is in neeed of some refurbishing, I did not find the condition of the hotel to be shabby, as reported by some. From the moment you climb the stairs of the grand porch to enter the lobby - you are hearkened back to an earlier, more elegant era. While the property is a little worn around some edges, I found that it added to the charm and would worry that a re-do might take away some of that charm. The whole hotel is spacious and airy. Our two adjoining rooms, including the foyer connecting them, ran approximately seventy feet!! Even the bathrooms were spacious- a double- sinked counter with plenty of counter space (a rarity in many European hotels), and with a full size window overlooking the magnificent beach. The rooms were immaculate. A very ample breakfast buffet is served in a beautiful large breakfast room which opens onto the large wraparound porch and permits al fresco dining. We had brunch and found we could skip lunch, and with just a little snack in the afternoon to tide us over, we were good to go until our delicious dinner. The shuttle to the Excelsior to take the vaporetto to Venice was extremely convenient and reliable, and the vaporetto ride to Venice was picturesque and delighful, and provided the same sense, to me, of riding on the waterways of Venice so as to make a pricey gondola ride unnecessary. It was so convenient to take our car on the ferry and drive right up to the hotel and have the bellman take our luggage, that next time I return to Venice, I will again stay on Lido at the DesBain in order to avoid dealing with the struggle of toting the luggage through Venice, which I saw so many tourists deal with. (Parking was free, a pleasant surprise.) I cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Venice.... The beach was magnificent and we splurged (100 Euros) and rented a lovely cabana in the first row on the beach. Even though we come from a beach town, the day we spent on Lido was the best of the trip. The beach and facilities were wonderful (and immaculate). The concierge service at the hotel was excellent. A note about a side rip to Murano The concierge was very willing to arrange for a boat to meet us at the Excelsior to take us to Murano (it was there by the time we got to the Excelsior five minutes later, even though he called for it just as we were leaving DesBains)! While it was fascinating to see the beautiful Murano glass being made and the spectacular showrooms, the prices are so over the top that you have to be crazy to make any substantial purchases. As an example, the lovely little Murano glass heart pendants with a black rubber necklace, which you can buy all days long at kiosks and shops in Venice for 5 Euros, sold for 40 Euros at the glass factory! They looked the same, and I cannot imagine any difference in quality to justify the exorbitant prices. A salesperson is assigned to you upon arrival at the factory and escorts you throughout the showrooms.. Even though we knew we were getting ripped off as we were doing it, I am embarrassed to say we spent several hundred dollars that I regretted by the time I got on the boat to return (As a consolation, we did pick up lovely, unique pieces that I did not see in shops in Venice). By the way, as prompt as they were about picking us up, we waited quite a while for the return boat- the driver took time to eat a full lunch while we waited. Bottom line- it is very interesting to see the glass being made, but unless you are confident that you are completely immune to high pressure sales tactics or have money to burn, approach Murano with caution. You may wind up spending more time than you wanted to (and money) taking this little excursion.

Reviews.Title: “Very 'belle epoch' feel”
Reviews.Author: NadirAhmad
Reviews.Content: Very classy and historic hotel in the Lido. The rooms and bathroom were average but spacious. The service was very good as was the morning breakfast buffet. Best part was a free boat shuttle to Piazza San Marco. Another great thing is that the beach is right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. Like everyone else, I read up on all the reviews to check if this was a decent hotel or not, and I am pleased to say it is. Lovely receptionists, helpful staff and concierge. The room was bright, spacious, with amazing views and all the amenities you need. The breakfast was also great - lots to eat! The vaporetto is a scenic 10 minute walk away, and the hotel also has a shuttle service to take you into Venice. The beach is literally on your doorstep. All in all, this is a really beautiful hotel to stay in, and staying in Lido was really great - it is lovely and relaxing..... I thoroughly recommend it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Quiet Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammi-loves-shopping
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel, i stayed here with my now ex husband on honeymoon and can honestly say that the hotel saved the trip for me and encouraged me to return for a later look. The rooms were magnificent, the service faultless and the food divine. The only criticism was the location as i wanted to spend time exploring venice, but with a private bus/launch to the mainland at least the journey was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A great old lady”
Reviews.Author: Londoner5870
Reviews.Content: I can't help thinking people who complain about the age of the Hotel Des Bains are missing the point. Sure, it's not refurbished to look like every other corporate hotel of the early 21st century - and it has some creaky floorboards. But what it has above everything is great charm: it's a relaxing and pleasant place to stay. On the plus side: great pool, lovely gardens and immaculate terrace. Housekeeping is of a very high standard and the hotel was clean and a nice environment. The concierges are brilliant. Air conditioning worked plenty good enough for me. On the minus side: Breakfast is good quality but can be a bit of a bun-fight (almost literally) when the hotel is full. Some of the waiting staff lack the charm of the rest of the hotel's employees. But it gets back to a '5' overall because the restaurant food is delicious in what is a bit of a Lido culinary desert: the other local eateries are cheap and convenient, but don't really break out of the Tourist Menu syndrome that becomes depressing after a while. Overall, though, it's a wonderful cosmopolitan multi-lingual place with enough of its Bohemian past to keep it interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Hotel Des Bains”
Reviews.Author: Stanwich405
Reviews.Content: I read and re-read the reviews of this hotel many times while planning our trip to Italy. Because Hotel Des Bains is part of the Starwood group (Sheraton hotels), I was interested in staying here so that I could use our Starwood Points. We had two rooms, next to each other, facing the water. Both rooms were large with good size bathrooms. Having stayed at the Rome Hilton Cavelieri and Westin Excelsior in Florence prior to our arrival in Venice, we were a bit spoiled. Both of the previous hotels are beautiful. The Des Bains though did not disappoint us - I would definitely stay here again. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice. We didn't have time to use the pool but it looked beautiful. We did sit on the beach for a couple of hours and the water was clean, warm and delightful. We did not have breakfast included in our rate so I can't comment on that. However, one night we ate at the Pagoda Restaurant which is both of the hotel (across the street, overlooking the water). The food was different and delicious. Another evening we ate at a local restaurant on the island, it was very good, be sure to ask the concierge for suggestions. As far as the shuttles, this is was something I was worried about and wondered if it would be inconvenient. I thought it was great - a shuttle left every 1/2 hour to the Excelsior and then we boarded a shuttle boat immediately. The ride was very quick, 15 minutes or so and was a welcome relief to the hot, humid weather. It dropped us off at a very convenient location. It was not hard to plan your day or evening around the return shuttle times. They were always very prompt and easy to use. I was pleasantly surprised. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, it's a great place to go if you have kids especially due to the pool and large size of the rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Des Bains, Venice Lido Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Lungomare Marconi 17, 30126 Venice, Italy
